item.title: 要让英国重新增长，我们需要廉价、安全的能源
item.description:
经济学家西蒙-弗伦奇（Simon French）做客《Merryn Talks Money》栏目，讨论为什么促进英国经济增长应从鼓励北海油气生产开始。【原文：

Economist Simon French joins Merryn Talks Money to discuss why boosting the UK's growth should start with encouraging North Sea oil and gas production.

】

item.title: 人工智能需求激增，NextEra 采取措施重启核电站
item.description: NextEra Energy Inc. 已要求美国监管机构对其已关闭的杜安阿诺德核电厂的许可证进行变更，这是在人工智能和数据中心用电量激增的情况下可能重启爱荷华州核电厂的第一步。【原文：NextEra Energy Inc. has asked US regulators for a licensing change for its shuttered Duane Arnold nuclear plant, a first step toward potentially restarting the Iowa facility amid soaring power consumption from artificial intelligence and data centers.】

item.title: 全球外汇交易准则》修订版发布，重点关注透明度
item.description: 一个负责监督每天 7.5 万亿美元外汇市场最佳实践自愿守则的委员会修订了指导方针，以提高这个监管松散行业的透明度。【原文：A committee overseeing the voluntary code of best practices for the $7.5 trillion-a-day foreign-exchange market revised guidelines to boost transparency in the loosely-regulated industry.】

item.title: 日本央行明确加息指引安抚市场，但可能适得其反
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫将利率上调至 2008 年以来的最高水平，通过谨慎地向投资者表明其计划，避免了市场动荡。但这一策略也有风险。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda raised interest rates to the highest level since 2008, avoiding market turmoil by carefully signaling his plans to investors. But that strategy carries its own risks.】

item.title: Vanguard 的 S&P 500 基金即将成为全球最大的 ETF
item.description: 看似势不可挡的资金洪流让 Vanguard Group Inc.【原文：A seemingly unstoppable flood of money has Vanguard Group Inc. on the brink of claiming a crown that State Street Corp. has held for decades.】

item.title: 乔普拉留任美国联邦储蓄委员会，特朗普团队就银行监管机构人选展开辩论
item.description: 随着两位拜登时代任命的银行监管机构领导人本周继续出现在工作岗位上，一些唐纳德-特朗普的支持者质疑总统为什么没有提出领导这些机构的提名人选，或者至少解雇现任负责人。【原文：As two Biden-era appointees leading bank watchdogs continue to show up to work this week, some Donald Trump supporters are questioning why the president hasn’t put forward nominees to lead the agencies, or at a minimum fire the current heads.】

item.title: 荷兰国际集团（ING）预计东欧债务将因持续的预算困境而大量抛售
item.description: 据荷兰国际集团（ING Groep NV）称，中欧和东欧最大的国家今年将再次需要大量借贷，一系列选举将加剧控制预算赤字的努力。【原文：The largest central and eastern European nations will again need to borrow heavily this year, with a series of elections adding to struggles to rein in budget deficits, according to ING Groep NV.】

item.title: 梅尔文资本创始合伙人克莱默筹备长期基金
item.description: 在加布-普洛特金（Gabe Plotkin）的公司因错误的空头押注而关闭两年多后，梅尔文资本管理公司（Melvin Capital Management）的一位创始合伙人正准备推出一只选股对冲基金。【原文：A founding partner of Melvin Capital Management is preparing to launch a stock-picking hedge fund more than two years after Gabe Plotkin’s firm shuttered under the weight of wrong-way short bets.】

item.title: 减税 ETF 开拓者准备再揽 50 亿美元大单
item.description: 在处理了对冲基金向 ETF 的首次转换四年后，韦斯-格雷（Wes Gray）正准备领导一股针对大小投资者的减税交易热潮。【原文：Four years after handling the first conversion of a hedge fund to an ETF, Wes Gray is gearing up to lead a surge of tax-busting deals aimed at investors big and small.】

item.title: 工党应对新年以来大量糟糕的经济数据
item.description: 在工党执政的第一个完整年度伊始，就出现了大量令企业和家庭感到不安的经济坏消息，这将坚定政府推动经济增长的决心。【原文：The start of Labour’s first full year in power has been marked by an avalanche of bad economic news that is unsettling both businesses and households, and will reinforce the government’s determination to push for growth.】

item.title: 由马克思主义游击队推动的可卡因暴力席卷哥伦比亚
item.description: 哥伦比亚东部的卡塔通博山区非常危险，警察和军队因为害怕狙击手，一般都不会离开军营太远。【原文：The mountains of Catatumbo in eastern Colombia are so dangerous that the police and army generally don’t stray far from their barracks for fear of snipers.】

item.title: 受特朗普影响的达沃斯希望看到更多行动
item.description: 大家好，欢迎来到达沃斯，世界经济论坛刚刚结束，与会官员分享了全球经济的不安前景。【原文：Hello and welcome to Davos, where the World Economic Forum has just ended with officials sharing an uneasy outlook for the global economy.】

item.title: 特朗普的天然气提议引发达沃斯众人深思
item.description:
行业领袖支持欧洲的气候议程，但有些人可能会被总统的廉价燃料承诺所动摇。【原文：

Industry leaders back Europe’s climate agenda, but some may be swayed by the president’s promise of cheap fuel.

】

item.title: Meta 和 TikTok 将在德国大选前接受欧盟压力测试
item.description: 欧盟计划在下个月德国大选之前，对社交媒体公司反击虚假信息的计划进行质询，这是欧盟首次对国家选举进行 "压力测试"。【原文：The European Union plans to grill social media companies on their plans to counter disinformation ahead of the German election next month in the bloc’s first “stress test” for a national election.】

item.title: 尽管能源价格下降，巴西通胀放缓幅度低于预期
item.description: 尽管能源成本下降，但巴西 1 月初的年度通胀放缓幅度低于预期，这凸显了政策制定者在准备下周再次提高借贷成本时所面临的挑战。【原文：Brazil’s annual inflation slowed less than expected in early January despite a drop in energy costs, highlighting the challenges facing policymakers as they prepare to raise borrowing costs again next week.】

item.title: 英特尔、三星和中国芯片挑战令 ASML 前景黯淡
item.description: ASML Holding NV 下周发布的财报引发了半导体行业的震动，其顶级客户的支出计划也存在不确定性。【原文：After sending shockwaves through the semiconductor industry following a third-quarter earnings miss, scrutiny is building ahead of ASML Holding NV’s results next week with uncertainty over the spending plans of its top clients.】

item.title: 中国制造的无人机会成为特朗普 "TikTok "待遇的下一个目标吗？
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是我们改版后的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，德雷克-贝内特（Drake Bennett）将探讨中国制造的无人机是否会成为唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）赦免的下一个对象。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our revamped daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Drake Bennett considers whether Chinese-made drones could be next in line for a pardon from Donald Trump.】

item.title: 法国呼吁欧盟将巴塞尔交易规则延期一年
item.description: 在英国将新的银行交易资本规则的实施时间推迟到 2027 年之后，法国当局呼吁欧盟同意将新的银行交易资本规则的实施时间推迟到比原计划更长的时间。【原文：French authorities are calling for the European Union to agree to hold off on new bank capital rules on trading for longer than previously planned after the UK pushed back its implementation to 2027.】

item.title: 疫病爆发令德国猪肉出口设备雪上加霜
item.description: 德国近四十年来首次爆发口蹄疫疫情，这对该国举步维艰的猪肉行业来说是又一次打击。【原文：Germany’s first outbreak of foot-and-mouth disease in almost four decades is another blow for the country’s struggling pork sector.】

item.title: Verizon 凭借移动和宽带业务增长超出华尔街预期
item.description: Verizon Communications Inc. 公布的第四季度财务业绩超出分析师预期，其中包括新增移动电话和宽带用户的增长。【原文：Verizon Communications Inc. reported fourth-quarter financial results that beat analysts’ estimates, including gains in new mobile-phone and broadband customers.】

item.title: 拉里-芬克思考美国经济是否预示着日后将加息
item.description: 美国经济的强劲势头让贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.首席执行官拉里-芬克（Larry Fink）怀疑，美联储是否会在短期内放宽政策后，不得不在日后提高利率。【原文：The strength of the US economy is making BlackRock Inc. Chief Executive Officer Larry Fink wonder if the Federal Reserve may have to resort to increasing interest rates later after easing in the short term.】

item.title: 特朗普力推欧佩克，雪佛龙哈萨克斯坦油田扩产
item.description: 雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp.）周五表示，它已完成了哈萨克斯坦巨大的 Tengiz 油田的扩建工程，预计到 2025 年中期，该油田的日产量将达到 100 万桶。【原文：Chevron Corp. said Friday it completed an expansion at Kazakhstan’s huge Tengiz oil field, which is expected to ramp up to pump 1 million barrels a day by mid-2025.】

item.title: 尼日利亚财政部长表示，尼日利亚将在 2025 年利用一系列金融工具
item.description: 尼日利亚财政部长瓦莱-埃顿（Wale Edun）表示，这个非洲最大的石油生产国将利用一系列工具来帮助为今年的预算赤字融资，估计赤字约占国内生产总值的 3.9%。【原文：Nigeria’s Finance Minister Wale Edun said Africa’s largest oil producer will tap a range of instruments to help finance this year’s budget deficit, estimated at about 3.9% of gross domestic product.】

item.title: S&P 500 指数创里根总统以来最佳首周记录
item.description: 这是华尔街想要的。至少在本周，华尔街得到了它：一个对市场友好的唐纳德-特朗普--大谈促进增长和降低税收的政策，同时缩减了立即破坏世界贸易秩序的计划。【原文：It was what Wall Street wanted. And this week at least, it’s what Wall Street is getting: A market-friendly Donald Trump – talking up policies to boost growth and lower taxes, while dialing back plans to immediately disrupt the world trading order.】

item.title: 达沃斯对特朗普新时代的通胀精灵忧心忡忡
item.description: 2025 年达沃斯论坛最后一次会议认为，全球通胀尚未消退，中国以外的发达经济体不能在消费者浮躁和贸易紧张局势下掉以轻心。【原文：Global inflation hasn’t yet died and advanced economies outside China can’t be complacent at a time of fickle consumers and trade tensions, according to the last Davos panel of 2025.】

item.title: 价格下跌导致 JSW 钢铁公司季度利润骤降 70
item.description: 由于全球需求低迷和国内价格疲软，JSW 钢铁有限公司的利润未达预期。【原文：JSW Steel Ltd. missed profit forecasts following sluggish global demand and weak domestic prices.】

item.title: SES 为受马斯克 "星链 "计划影响的债券提供支持
item.description: 最近几周，卫星运营商 SES SA 因竞争加剧，特别是来自埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 Starlink 公司的竞争，债券受到冲击，SES SA 采取了支撑债券的措施，引发其债务大幅回升。【原文：Satellite operator SES SA moved to shore up bonds that have been hit in recent weeks by rising competition, particularly from Elon Musk’s Starlink, sparking a sharp recovery in its debt.】

item.title: 欧洲清算公司称，扣押俄罗斯资产可能带来意外结果
item.description: 欧洲清算有限公司（Euroclear Ltd.首席执行官瓦莱丽-乌尔班（Valerie Urbain）警告说，如果欧盟没收俄罗斯中央银行被冻结的资产，将会产生意想不到的后果。【原文：Euroclear Ltd. Chief Executive Officer Valerie Urbain warned of unintended consequences if the European Union were to confiscate frozen assets from Russia’s central bank.】

item.title: 疾病预防控制中心不向公众全面介绍不孕症治疗风险
item.description:
捐献卵子有健康风险。妇女无法了解哪家诊所的不良后果最少。【原文：

Egg donation comes with health risks. Women are unable to learn which clinics have the fewest adverse outcomes.

】

item.title: 父母与科技的关系比孩子更糟糕
item.description:
成年人牺牲社交联系，沉迷于手机，给孩子们树立了一个坏榜样。【原文：

Adults are sacrificing social connection to veg out with their phones, setting a bad example for kids.

】
